Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: RobinSanJose
Reviews.Content: If you're going to San Diego and want to stay near the Gas Lamp District or downtown, you'll find most hotels VERY pricey. Howevere, this hotel is off the beaten path in Old Town and you can get for a lot less. They offer free breakfast, free wifi, and have free shuttle to and from the airport, to the GasLamp District, Convention Center, etc. While it's not the same as being directly downtown, it's a great price and gets you there!

Reviews.Title: “highway noise ruins otherwise good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtNatureLvr
Reviews.Content: With a friendly staff, clean, relatively spacious rooms for the price that include a refrigerator, microwave, free internet and extended breakfast hours, it's too bad that noise from the freeway is so loud. I'm a heavy sleeper, so it didn't keep me awake, but it was unpleasant. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless freeway noise really doesn't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Murrieta1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the freeway, and though we got used to the noise it would not be good for light sleepers. It is also a long way from Old Town. We stayed on the 2nd floor, and whenever the people above us walked, the ceiling squeaked real loud, and sleeping was difficult. The hotel has a shuttle which is supposed to go to the airport and downtown, but whenever we tried to take it to downtown, it was too full with people going to the airport. The carpet is a bit old, and had a slight moldy smell. What we liked: good breakfast, covered parking, free wifi, and lots of outlets in the room for charging things.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled but Okay”
Reviews.Author: CodyandCyndi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean - Good Hotel staff was friendly - Good Convenient location - Good Neighborhood sketchy - Not so good Room was noisy - other tenants loud, I think an elephant was staying in the room above us. The traffic from the highway was loud, the train was our own personal alarm and the airplanes were just an added touch - Not so good Room was as pictured but definitely deceiving, smaller than anticipated, a bit worn out The parking there STINKS.... Okay people, COMPACT painted on a parking spot is NOT a an instruction!! Don't go and jam your big 'ol Tahoe in a spot for a Ford Fiesta.... find somewhere else to park so you're not forcing us all to consider alternate methods to enter our own vehicles. WARNING. Bring a can opener just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy0120
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days in April 2012. The rate was excellent for the quality of service the hotel provides. Most places in San Diego charge for parking and Internet, both were free and that was a nice surprise. The breakfast was just alright, but free made it better - cinnamon rolls, eggs, pancakes, coffee, juice, muffins, biscuits and gravy, yogurt. The walk to Old Town is not too far, we walked down and back on 2 nights to avoid having to drive after margaritas. There is a shuttle service but we never used it because we had a rental car. Easy drive to jump on the I-5 and go anywhere you want, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GandJ2011
Reviews.Content: I was leary to book a hotel near the airport as they are usually pretty worn. This was defintely a pleasant surprise! Newly updated, within walking distance to Old Town and very convenient to airport. We stayed our first and last night and it worked very well for us! The hotel staff was VERY helpful and very intentive! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we were told our 2 queen bed room was upgraded to a king with sofa bed. With 2 adults and 2 teenage girls we did not considered this an upgrade but were told they were out of 2 queen rooms. After some discussion, a 2 queen room was found. Unfortunately, the room faced the freeway (our request had been to be away from the freeway - the noise is noticeable) and the room smelled like a locker room. A staff person brought us some air freshner after stopping by and admitting it smelled. That helped for a while and although it wasn't as bad, the smell did return later on. Since no other rooms were available, we were stuck with it. They did discount the room after more discussion which was appreciated but did not do anything for the smell. Positive features.. the pool and breakfast were nice, as was underground parking. Am guessing most stays here are much better but unfortunately, ours was not one we could recommend overall.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, fine staff, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jimkellster
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel and can't come up with a complaint. Reception staff was attentive, polite, and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful, the rooms comfortable. The place just seemed cozy and tucked away even though it adjoins a freeway and is near the airport. Easy access to Old Town, the Mission Beach/Pacific Beach areas and just a short drive to LaJolla. Wireless internet, free newspapers, well stocked shop for snacks and drinks. While not a brand new property, updating and attention to detail made this a non-issue. This was a surprisingly good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kteacherMaine
Reviews.Content: I was worried that I might be on my own in San Diego, so I picked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and the information about the free shuttle bus drop off locations. I'm so glad I did!! I'm also glad my friend was able to join me. The hotel was very clean and had a great free breakfast. The breakfast included a pancake maker, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, four cereals (Raisin Bran, Honey Nut Cheerios?, something like Fruit Loops, and one other one), warm cinnamon buns, coffee, two or three juices (orange, cranberry and apple?), bananas, whole milk and reduced fat milk, toast, bagels, and English Muffins. Some days they had scrambled eggs or a cheese omelet, and some days they had bacon or sausage. They also provide a free newspaper and apples at a table near the front desk. The hotel had free wi-fi. There is also an elevator and a 24 hour small grocery/supply store. I believe it is a smoke free hotel. The shuttle bus service was wonderful. They will pick up from the airport (until 11 PM, I believe). They also take people to the airport as early as 5 AM, but let them know a day ahead of time. If you sign up for the shuttle a day in advance, they will take you to the zoo at 9:30 AM and pick you up at 4:30. With advance notice they will also take you to Sea World at 10:30 AM and pick you up at 5:30. We also had them take us to Old Town and pick us up several times. We did tip the drivers. Old Town is a straight shot on San Diego Avenue. Some people may even want to walk there. The San Diego Transit system has a stop in Old Town. You can use the Coaster rail, the Blue Line or the Green Line there. The Old Town Trolley also has a stop located in Old Town. I definitely picked the right hotel for us. I would choose this hotel again. We were there from March 27-April 3, 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: IABeachBum
Reviews.Content: We picked this motel becasue it had shuttle service and it worked out great! We could get most anywhere with the shuttle. If you wanted to go to the bay, you just took the shuttle to the convention center. Old Town was an easy and safe walk and I could walk there and have a cocktail while everyone relaxed or if they felt like going to be earlier than me. There is an excellent Breakfast Burrito right across the street at Dos Brassos (??) The rest of the family like the free breakfast at the motel which saved a small fortune over 7 days. Beds were SUPER comfortable, everything clean. OH, almost forgot, 2 minute shuttle ride to Old Town Transit center and you can be anywhere in San Diego in about a half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to request main lodging”
Reviews.Author: Al W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while travelling to/from Honolulu. The shuttle is very nice and on time. It takes you to/from airport and SeaWorld. Other shuttle areas could be requested. Hotel is clean and breakfast is as Express should be. You need to make sure that you request the main lobby sleeping area though. If you fly in late, you may get stuck in the additional side part of the hotel. Our air condtioner did not work correctly. The hair dryer did not work, even after resetting GFCI. There was a sign posted (see attached) at the entrance to this addition. When we questioned the front desk as to its meaning, they replied that it was due to the breakfast not offering organic food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Seervice and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gog8urs
Reviews.Content: Very clean. We were on the opposite side from the freeway. I imagine the freeway side is a bit noisy. The friendliness of the staff was outstanding and the breakfast better than most "breakfast included" hotels. We were there for Marine Graduation and they did everything to accommodate our needs that included on-call shuttle service to and from the base and anywhere within reason we wanted to go. Rooms are smallish but clean and comfortable. If we were to be back in the area, we would stay here again. You can find larger and more plush and more expensive but we felt this was a good value for what we needed. It is close to Old Town but more than a short walk. They will shuttle you there if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and smoky”
Reviews.Author: nadia o
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for the price and convenience (breakfast and parking included). As we have club card Intercontinental,they gave us a "preference room". What a joke! The hotel is very noisy, acoustic insulation is poor, and although they say smoke-free, there were people smoking freely. We use the microwave (old and no maintenance) and came back the next day, it was still dirty. If you want to spend sleepless nights and inhaling smoke, stay in this hotel. Otherwise, run away!

Reviews.Title: “New location, not as convenient to Old Town, better quality property”
Reviews.Author: trvlr7311
Reviews.Content: I went to the same place as always...and the hotel was not there. They should put some kind of notice of moving on the Priority Club reservation pages. Fortunately the folks at what is now a Fairfield Inn, Marriott, were very helpful in finding the Holiday Inn Express. A bad start aside, the new property has much nicer rooms, seems newer, and parking is more convenient. I did not ask for any special room (as I did not know the hotel had moved) and was assigned a room practically on I-5. Request a room away from the freeway unless they install some sort of better sound sealed windows. Clean, great room (physically), good breakfast, well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel for 1 overnight”
Reviews.Author: cincom_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable and clean, but definately not what I expected for the price. It was also further away from the airport than its name suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: GloriousGrey
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked a room for the day explaining that we would be arriving early on a cruise ship and leaving late afternoon for the airport. We agreed to pay a full overnight room rate for the use of a room and the hotel facilities. We arrived by Limo at around 10:30 and were told a room was not ready for us. We could leave our cases in the closet in an uncleaned room and it would be at least 2 hours before it would be cleaned. We booked for a 6pm shuttle to the airport and our name was entered on a sheet and we were asked which airline. We walked the ten minutes into Old Town and took a pleasant Trolley Tour for a couple of hours, then ate a great Tex-Mex lunch and returned to a now clean and serviced room. At 6pm we awaited a shuttle. It didn't arrive. When a bus did pull in the driver had no knowledge that we had booked a shuttle trip. The front desk staff seemed disinterested and did not look as if they were enjoying their job. We saw some oriental guests, obviously having trouble understanding the directions to their room, receive little if no help from front desk staff. The hotel has little or no facilities. On the good side it is near to the Old Town, just a 15 minute walk. The rooms are well equipped and have good fast wireless internet, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/service/staff/location!”
Reviews.Author: Fitzab1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for seeing San Diego. Walking distance to Old Town and the trolly/bus terminal. Excellent complementary breakfast. The staff is very helpful and complementary shuttle service much appreciated. Thanks especially to Ryan & Alex!

Reviews.Title: “Best HIE experience in three continents!”
Reviews.Author: Cmd4me
Reviews.Content: I don't say that lightly having stayed at mostly HIEs in the US, Asia, and Europe. The shuttle service to and from the airport was great. What made it even better was the complimentary service to Old Town, Seaworld, and the zoo. The drivers were always friendly and prompt. The hotel is located near the freeway and railway but our room was on the opposite side so it was minimal. The free wifi was reliable but it makes you sign back in with your password each day. The speed wasn't blazing but it served its purpose for e-mail and web browsing. I downloaded a few TV shows for the flight back and it took longer than my 10MB connection at home. If you've eaten at HIE before, the cinnamon rolls are hot and ready. Plenty of coffee at breakfast and 24/7 by the front desk. Priority members receive a small gift bag upon arrival. The free coffee 24/7 was nice since I wake up much earlier than breakfast serving time (6am). Two newspapers are available first come first serve, USA Today and the local paper. Food items include the juice bar, pancake maker (flat, no taste), eggs (avoid), biscuits were okay, the gravy helps a little. Includes sausage and egg omelet (tasty, not bad at all), milk and cereals, boiled eggs, amd yogurt. Nothing really impressive to write home about except the coffee with favored creamers and the warm cinnamon rolls. The king bed room was huge, the bathroom was the largest of all HIEs we've been in. The jacuzzi was a nice touch, including the TV on the wall. The refrigerator came in handy for cold drinks and leftovers. The staff went out of their way for anything we needed, and always with a smile. Staying at this location made our experience in San Diego very enjoyable and worry free. You won't be disappointed, good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: lalyki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending our son's graduation from MCRD. This is a perfect location for those attending the MCRD graduations. Only minutes from Gate 5! The staff was very pleasant as were the accommodations. We would highly recommend this hotel for those that are looking to save some money, but also receive a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: carcross
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Was platinum PC member and received free upgrade to a suite. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel also had a small convenience store which was nice, and unusual for Holiday Inn Expresses. Typical Holiday Inn Express breakfast. The entrance off of the street was a bit confusing, but they have a parking ramp underneath that made parking easy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Express”
Reviews.Author: Marconap
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing special, considering that the rate was pretty close to much better hotels in downtown, I would not choose it again. The convenience was the airport shuttle and the breakfast (again standard at other Holiday Inn Express).

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare!”
Reviews.Author: zedsmummy
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in San diego and wish they both nights had been at this hotel. The rooms were clean, well appointed and had comfortable beds. The hot tub and heated outdoor pool were nice bonuses in the cool weather. However the real stand out at this hotel is the staff!!! Everyone of the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was the best possible. The shuttle driver even took us to the pharmacy and waited while we picked up a few things. He showed us an amazing view of downtown San Diego and stopped to let us take photos. I almost don't want to write a good review for the property because then everyone will stay here and the next time I visit San Diego I won't be able to get a room! Yes, it's that good!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, close to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Beno1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at HIX Old Town. The room was lovely and clean and surprisingly quiet, given its close proximity to the Highway/Airport. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. There is a free shuttle bus to the main attractions (ie Seaworld, Old Town, MSS Midway). There is also plenty of parking for your vehicle.. Old Town is within walking distance (about 5 - 10 minutes) and there are some excellent restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olovers
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The management and team are great to work with and will to help when needed. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Madding Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Miss_meggie35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Old Town last weekend mainly because of the parking, value and the opportunity for rewards. When I looked at reviews for many of the other hotels in San Diego, there was a general consensus that you got fleeced for Valet parking, then you had to wait forever to get your car. Not so at this hotel. Parking is free and self-serve. The breakfast was not 5 star, but I really didn't expect it to be, it had reasonable variety and I didn't have to pay extra for it. We paid less than I expected, given the proximity to downtown and Old Town, overall excellent value. The staff were warm and friendly. The guys at the desk at night were courteous and fun and answered questions knowledgeably. There is a shuttle that can take you to Old Town, the Zoo, Seaport and the airport... pretty much everywhere we were interested in going. We could probably have skipped getting the car. If it's your first trip to San Diego, you can get away with no car if you are flexible about waiting for the shuttle and are going to the regular tourist stops. You can also take the shuttle to Old Town and hop onto the trolley ($34) to get into Coronado for excellent beaches. Cons The layout of the hotel is odd, there are two sections to the hotel, and you have to walk outside to get to the breakfast room and the front desk. The room we stayed in overlooked the pool and was outside of the secured door, the only thing between you and the main street is the pool, no locks or keycard access doors. Initially that made us feel a little unsafe, but it is really a quiet neighborhood and we eventually got over it. You can walk to Old Town, but it's a 10-15min trek. We walked 3 times, and it was a good walk every time, so I guess that's not really a con. The freeway is right there... really... right there... we had to change rooms because of freeway noise. The planes feel like they are directly over your head as they come into the city, more noise to contend with, but it became white noise at some point for me. Overall though, it was a great time. The hotel has a renovated feel which I liked. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet hotel with breakfast, not overcrowded with tourists and with no hassle for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe Holiday Inn brand is associated with it.”
Reviews.Author: psahaye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked it for two nights for our first ever trip to San Diego for its price and our loyalty to Priority Club. The property is beaten up with old smelly carpets in corridors. The rooms are ok but the wireless internet was super slow. There were two phones in room and the one on bedside never worked despite complaint. The hotel rooms are right next to I-5 and despite double glazed windows, the noise gets to you late in night unless you are a heavy sleeper and nothing disturbs you. However, the wirst was reserved for breakfast where we were having juices mixed with water and scrambled eggs soaked in water. We informed the front desk but there was no change the next morning except that they had omlettes that were not soaked. The quality of breads, muffins, pancakes and coffee left us convinced that we would have been better off paying more and staying at another place. What is more shocking is the range of positive reviews which I just can't believe to be true. But to each his own. Next time I shall take such reviews with a pinch of salt.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: vistc
Reviews.Content: we stayed here iin dec and couldnt be happier....excellent staff from the cleaning crew to the front desk.....they were just great....breakfast was quite good....would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: cancan64
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here, 2 adults and 2 young children. Good location within an easy walk to the old town (although free bus shuttle saved this). Staff wee friendly and rooms clean. Good breakfast selection and handy to all attractions. Free car park as well and the staff were more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Kayakqueen10
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at this hotel. It's in an odd location, but an easy few block walk to Old Town and very close to highways to access downtown and the beaches. Our one complaint was the spa was overly-chlorinated to the point our skin itched for 2 days afterwards. We only went in that one time because it made us so uncomfortable. Rooms were clean, breakfast was great, people were friendly. Overall a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: zed1958
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel while visiting San Diego on vacation. Its location is convenient to the airport and has easy access to I-5, so getting to other area attractions is quite easy from the hotel. However, because it's immediately adjacent to I-5, traffic noise can be a problem for some rooms. Even the receptionist told me that he gave me a "quiet" room when I checked in (one facing away from the Interstate). There's not much in the immediate area of the hotel in the way of restaurants or shops; it has a bit of a commercial, almost industrial feel in the neighborhood. Check-in was quick and easy at 8:00 PM on a Saturday night, and it was easy to find a parking spot in the free underground garage. The room (single queen bed) was clean and updated, albeit a little small but just fine for a solo traveler. It had an in-room safe and had 12 available electrical outlets (two on the base of each of three lamps and a six-outet wall outlet) which meant I had no problem charging my laptop, cell phone, or camera batteries. The wireless Internet access was free (password required), but a bit intermittent. When I commented to the front desk, they checked into it and the service has been better since. One other thing that was interesting was the fact that the bathroom door had a spring-loaded door closer which kept the door closed all the time. This meant that the heat couldn't get into the bathroom so it was a bit chilly in the morning. I had to prop the door open. All in all, I was pleased with my stay and the value, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: alkonost45
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and decently furnished rooms. Good breakfast. Great overnight reception people. Problematic wireless Internet. Went down in evening and reception was no authorized to reset it. Was told that it would be reset (cycle power) when maintenance person arrived at 8am in the morning - which it was. Also, before I booked this hotel as I was arriving in San Diego, I phoned hotel and was told that airport shuttle ran 24-hours a day. Not so, it is actually 5am to 11pm. A taxi from airport to hotel will cost you approx $15.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sailorman73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for 2 days, then left to attend a function in Oceanside and returned to San Diego and stayed another 3 days at this Inn. We were particularly impressed with the desk staff. They were very helpful in getting a botched car reservation sorted out. Our room was on the lower level overlooking the I5, but because of the sound barrier the traffic noise was not a problem. Don't know what it is like at the upper level. The room was clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast they serve is fairly extensive and the breakfast room is large enough that there is always room to sit. The Inn is conveniently located to many attractions and has ample free parking. However, parking elsewhere is a headache. I was not aware that I had to call the Inn from the airport to have the shuttle pick us up. So we wound up taking a cab - added a bit to our expenses. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWinsted_Ct
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an MCRD Graduation. (my Grandson) It was very clean, the bedding surprisingly luxurious, the breakfast more than adequate, the staff friendly and helpful. The shuttle service was great and the driver's could not have been nicer or more helpful. We did have a room overlooking the highway so there was traffic noise, but it really was almost like white noise, not a big deal. What was a larger issue was the amount of noise from the room above us and therefore knowing your noise might be offending someone. I am not one to be troubled by someone else's noise, but I did worry that I might be bothering someone else.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Property moved without notification”
Reviews.Author: Jollymon22
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the old Holiday Inn Express in Old Town San Diego which was just steps from the Old Town resturants and shops as recently as five months prior to our most recent return visit In the interim they physically relocated to another location some eight blocks away. Imagine my surprise when they dropped us off at the new location! There was no notification at the old site earlier and none on their website when making reservations. They moved to the site of a previous hotel that backs up to the interstate. To their credit, they did some nice renovations, but the new location really offers nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Drose6550
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. Very clean, basic, wonderful, attentive staff. Nice unassuming hotel when you don't want to pay Hilton prices.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle issues”
Reviews.Author: gypsyretirees
Reviews.Content: HI Express is a nicely upgraded older hotel (Comfort Inn, I believe) near San Diego International Airport. I booked a room there because of the availability of an airport shuttle. During the morning of our check-in day, I called the hotel to check on the shuttle and was told to book it when I checked into the hotel. Upon our check-in at 5:00 that afternoon I was told that it was full. Since a later time was not acceptable, my husband and I had to order a taxi. Given that I had called earlier, that I had a confirmed reservation, and that I am a Holiday Inn VIP member, I really expected to have a space on the shuttle. Was I unreasonable? Whatever? I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get more noisy than this place”
Reviews.Author: wilkinson123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in October 2011. The property is a bit worn and is a typical HIE property. The noise from the freeway not 20 meters from our bedroom window was unbearable. We turned up the air conditioning to full thinking it might drown out the noise of the cars but it didn't even help. If traffic noise is a problem for you avoid this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great place great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rowley848
Reviews.Content: It was a nice clean room in the historic Old Town. Surrounded by great shopping and good restaurants. Awesome free breakfast, omelet, sausage,biscuits, gravy, bread,muffins,fruit,cereal, pancakes, yogurt and juices, milk and coffee. Friendly staff that will drive you anywhere in Old Town and recommend great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DebiInFresno
Reviews.Content: We needed a room in a hurry and went due to the name being known to us. The room was clean, the parking was simple but what stood out was the customer service. The desk staff was very welcoming. We had a wonderful young man shuttle us to Old Town for dinner and they were very professional and did their best to be sure we had a nice stay. We would stay there again, the location was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Marine Corps graduation”
Reviews.Author: MEGMichigan
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its proximity to MCRD and the fact that they have a shuttle to the base for Family Day and graduation day. Hotel was very clean; staff was friendly and very helpful with information about the graduation schedule. Complimentary continental breakfast had a great variety of choices (breakfast room is a bit small, though). Not sure what "Aussiegirlfamily" is talking about; there are no waitresses--it's a free buffet).Free Wifi in the room and 2 computers in the lobby was a great convenience. We were there during the widespread power outage in Sept. and I was dismayed to discover the hotel had no generator. Fortunately, the windows were operable but the freeway traffic made it impossible to sleep (not the hotel's fault); but you wouldn't want to hang out on the patio either due to the traffic noise. Old Town is very close, and the hotel offers a shuttle if you don't care to walk. The shuttle will also take you to the airport; just be sure to give yourself plenty of time since it only holds about 12 people at a time. Location is a bit far from downtown and the beaches, so I wouldn't recommend it if that's your intended destination, but it worked out great for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirlfamily
Reviews.Content: The first night a piece of the bath fell off, we rang reception to be told 'we will get maintenace to come and have a look' 2 days and no action later we checked out. Free breakfast was a farce as the waitress on the first day charged for everything but the next two mornings they didnt? Parking was included as was WiFi. Lots of floors & rooms for a few old elevators to cater for.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, quiet, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: cswift53
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to see the cozy room with the comfortable bed after a long plane ride. Best of all, there was no parking fees in a town that has nothing but! The room was small but very, very comfortable- perfect for a solo traveler. I am sure the room sizes vary. The staff was efficient and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was great!! Being a smoker from the southeast (EST), I was happy the smoking area was a safe place. Hotel was very convenient to the airport and within walking distance to Old Town. Reasonable rates adn very clean. This will be my new home when flying into or out of SAN.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelmoreSoCal
Reviews.Content: My friend booked 5 rooms for a weekend celebration we were having in Old Town SD. She emailed us one of the room info with the reservation # given by the hotel and our names under the reservation. When I got there right around 3pm, the check-in time, I gave them my name, my friend's name, and the reservation #. They looked it up and told me it's already being occupied by someone else, who's name I recognize as one of the people in our party. She tells me that since the reservation # is already used and that our name wasn't even on their system, she can't assign me another room because not everyone has checked in yet. This was all done next to whom I found out was their manager, who could care less what was going on. The two women had no desire to help or offer another option. It was one of the worst attitudes I've ever encountered when it comes to the hotel check-in process. Luckily, my friend who made all the reservations arrived 15 minutes later so she had all the printed confirmation with her. It turned out the hotel screwed up on the reservation and assigned the same, exact reservation # to two sets of different people! Of course by then, the manager already left so there was no accountability. Anyway, on to the hotel itself. It's not bad, but it is located next to the freeway so it can be a little noisy if your room is on the side of the freeway (which ours was). The room is actually a good size with comfortable beds and linen. The TV wasn't plugged in all the way so we had to figure out what was wrong with it for a few minutes. They have a nice size mini-frig and microwave. The shower had good water pressure although the toilet takes forever to flush. They gave three bath towels and three face towels, but no hand towels though. This is the first hotel I've ever been to that doesn't have all three sizes of towels. Standard soaps and shampoo and conditioner. The free breakfast was nice, had yogurts, bananas, juice, cereal, biscuits, gravy, sausage patty, and egg with melted cheese in it already. Also bagels/other breads and a machine to make pancakes. They also have a 24-hour snack shop that's pretty convenient. We didn't use the internet or wireless access but that's also available. Their pool is sort of small and their jacuzzi smaller but they open late. The workout room also has some nice machines to get a good workout. Parking is kind of odd especially when first parking to register. Since it's one way, you have to leave the hotel and make a u-turn to turn back into the driveway to park underground. The elevator to the rooms are accessed by the room keys but since the doors to the inside hallway aren't locked, you can still walk up the stairs to get inside. It's not a bad value (we paid $99 pretax) per night since it comes with breakfast but the horrible check-in episode totally soured the whole thing for me. Those two women need some training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Angela2155
Reviews.Content: I booked this room thru expedia, pictures looked nice. Well when we arrived I realized that this used to be called comfort inn, that I reluctantly stayed at a couple years ago. I felt deceived, for one, the pictures were not from this property and our room was advertised as a queen bed, it was a full. The room themselves were clean and remodeled, but the bed & pillows were so uncomfortable. We went to sit in the jacuzzi one night and there were about 7 employees (still in their uniforms) drinking 40oz beers. I definitely don't think $120/night is worth it. Find another place.

Reviews.Title: “San-Di-Hey-Go!”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here three times and will keep returning. The rooms do vary in size/price but really there are no negatives - great value, convenient carparking for a small fee, quiet, excellent free continental breakfast and comfy beds. San Diego Old Town is a very nice part of SD and well worth exploring. A special mention to the staff - very cheerful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: ckwcraig
Reviews.Content: Only here one night. Very convenient location. Good for joggers because you can jog up and down in Old Town San Diego. Tiny fitness center, only treadmills and elliptical. Small pool and separate hot tub. Complimentary breakfast is pretty good. Very close to all the Mexican restaurants in Old Town, you could walk. Room rates are cheap, best rates were on holidayinn.com website. Recent renovation, comfortable bed. Very close to highway. I didn't notice road noise but my boyfriend did and said it woke him up (he's a light sleeper). Awesome convenience store in lobby. Friendly staff but one chick who answers phone is clueless and irritating (Hi, is it possible to jog near the hotel? I don't know. Are you in a call center? No, I'm in the hotel. Then how do you not know? I don't know. Can you transfer me to someone else? No one else is here. Thanks a lot.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic~When we are SD again we will be back~”
Reviews.Author: Fressia
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday, late afternoon, and we met Jose at the front desk, he and the other young man, Josh (?) were great. Our room was small but very nice, all new furnishings, and bedding, and the room was very clean, I slept soundly, great bed.\ The only problem was the new LG TV, the only colors on the screen were gold and blue, we weren't in our room that long, so it didn't matter. The breakfast in the morning was the best we have ever had at any of the Holiday Inn Expresses we have stayed in the past. Delores, the lady making sure the breakfast foods were hot and available, and the rest of the staff worked very hard to keep up with the crowd. They all deserve 5 stars for all of their work. We will certainly book a room again when we return to San Diego~ Note on the homeless we saw two but far away from the Inn, the neighborhood is nice, and further west of the Inn are very nice homes, over all its close to downtown, 3-4 miles to Anthony's Fish Grotto, and about a mile to Old Town. As suggested, we requested a room away from the freeway, we stayed in #305, it faced the street, and it was very quiet. Suggest that if you are there on a week-end that you request the shuttle service, well in advance, SD Old Town was packed and no parking, lots were charging $12.00. Since it was Sunday, we drove our own car to Anthony's Fish Grotto, and found free metered parking, right across the street. Please note that there is really no problem with the drapes, yes, they are not full drapes, (Very nice) but behind the sheer's there are two additional draw drapes for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in the West!”
Reviews.Author: bbbd69
Reviews.Content: Hats off to the best hotel in San Diego in my opinion. The staff here is superb, professional, and very friendly. These people never have "bad days". Management should be thrilled to have employees like these. Wonderful and clean rooms. Breakfast was awesome with very friendly and helpful staff. Easy access of the highway with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: boat07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern and the staff friendly and helpful. I would ask for a room that was not on the side of the freeway and close to the pool. It is further away from the main entrance, but a nicer location. The hotel was kept very clean and I would recommend it to people who are looking for a hotel that they will not be spending alot of time at and who are there to be visiting friends there or will be out enjoying the many things San Diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but needs a little detailing...”
Reviews.Author: JenofLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of ComiCon and the hotel overall was pretty good. I was a little concerned when we got there and the toilet had what appeared to have ashes in it. Otherwise, the room seemed okay. The air conditioner worked well, and the room was quiet. They offer a free breakfast which is a nice benefit; breakfast room buffet style, eggs with cheese, sausage and biscuits, pancakes made to order in a machine, bagels, pastries, cereal and juice. Pretty much something for everyone unless you're vegan, then it's juice and fruit with toast but of course, this isn't meant for an alternative crowd and they do a good job of having plenty for all. The staff is super friendly, their shuttle service was very accommodating to both the Convention Center a nd the train station. My main complaint about this hotel, and for me, this is a BIG one... is that their drapes don't close all the way. And by that I mean, they have these little half-drapes that do not draw shut, with sheer white curtains in the middle, so you have the harsh light of morning greeting you at first light. One of the lovely things about staying in a hotel is drawing the drapes and shutting out the light and there is no way to shut it out here. I ended up stacking my pillows up on one side of the bed to kind of block some of the light from the bed but it didn't really work. Stupidest window dressing I've ever seen in a hotel. So that bummed me out. Otherwise, everything else was okay but they lost a star over the bad window dressings!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for new hotel in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: TechMarauder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new (well the building is the old Comfort Inn, but it was COMPLETELY remodeled). The room is comfortable, efficient, and quiet (especially on the San Diego Ave side!), The staff was helpful and courteous. The free parking, internet, and breakfast were all added bonuses. I REALLY liked the tremendous HD options on the brand new LCD flat screen. (I mean, there are like 100+ HD channels) All in all, I would stay there again in SD. Oh, and it's within walking distance to a great seafood restaurant (Blue Water Seafood).

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: gooseberries47
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. Had a guest laundry, which was great for us. Breakfast was pretty good. About a 10-15 minute walk to old town tourist activities, although they have a shuttle that will take you there too. Very happy with out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with One Tragic Flaw”
Reviews.Author: comsewogian
Reviews.Content: My family booked this hotel at an advanced purchase rate for our vacation when it was still at its old address, and when we found out the property had moved, we were a little nervous, but those nerves went (mostly) unwarranted after our arrival. With the exception of one thing that isn't really the hotel's fault, it is a wonderful place to stay for either a night waiting for a flight out of San Diego Airport, or for a few nights of vacation (which was how long our stay was for). For the positive things to say about this place, I want to start with the staff. They were all very nice, especially the front desk, where they were always helpful and willing to answer every question knowledgeably and quickly. I would shout out everyone by name but the only name that I can really remember is James(?) from the front desk who kept getting us an extra towel every night because we only had three and we were four people. But the individual names aren't that important because they were all wonderful. I also want to praise the hotel's security. If you are not a registered guest with a room key, you cannot get into any part of the hotel with the exception of course being the lobby. Even the elevator in the parking garage required a key card in order to use it. It made me at least feel safe knowing that no one could just walk into the hotel. The breakfast was phenomenal each day, with fruit, cereal, pancakes, bagels, mini muffins, toast, eggs, bacon or sausage, biscuits with sausage gravy, and most importantly the cinnamon rolls which are to die for. Plenty of options, all delicious. The rooms are pretty spacious, and tastefully decorated. Ours was located on the freeway side so it's a little noisy at night when you're trying to sleep, but it's manageable. So the hotel's tragic flaw is honestly just its location. Wile it is conveniently only 5 blocks from Old Town, it is also not far from the air[port, so the immediate surrounding area isn't so great...we saw more than a few homeless wandering the streets near the hotel, which doesn;t speak well for the location. Again, this isn't entirely the hotel's fault, because their previous location was only two blocks further up the road, so it's the area in general. If this is a turnoff for you then stay elsewhere, but if you're just looking for a good hotel with friendly staff, clean spacious rooms and great breakfast, then this the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent newly renovated property”
Reviews.Author: Camnicsydney
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here as we had a 7am departure from San Diego airport. As I was unfamiliar with the proximity of downtown etc we thought it would be a convenient base. Overall I was extremely happy with the newly branded Holiday Inn Express and the value we received for just under $130/nt incl tax. The hotel is 100% located parallel to the freeway so I requested a room facing away from the freeway and Jose was very happy to oblige when we checked in just after 8pm. In fact Jose was friendly, attentive and helpful....which is not the usual response when you check into a property so late in the day. We had rm #347 and you could not hear a peep from the freeway! The one complaint my husband had was that the airconditioner was very noisy. To make matters worse it kept turning itself on/off all night which was noisy and frustrating. We couldnt seem to figure out how to keep it constantly on...if management could somehow fix this I think it would certainly help. I would suggest bringing ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. We had a rental car from Enterprise and it was literally down the road so it was very convenient so early in the morning. The Holiday Inn Express also had a little convenience store in the lobby which was open 24 hours so you could easily grab some water or some snacks to tide you over. The renovation was really well done - new carpet, furniture, microwave, kettle, tv, duvet set etc...even the bathroom had been preened (still keeping in with some of the retro outfit though). All in all I was very happy with the Holiday Inn Express...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for stay before a cruise and for visit to San Diego's Old Town”
Reviews.Author: happitrails2me
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay. They had a shuttle from the airport and to the cruise pier plus it is within walking distance to the Old Town.They have a free breakfast buffet. The staff is pleasant and helpful. They are in the process of remodeling the rooms but this did not affect our stay and it will be even nicer when complete.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djb046
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, in order to attend our son's Marine Corps graduation. The hotel shuttles transported us to and from the airport, Battalion meet and greet, which was 1.5 miles away, and to and from the base. The drivers were very friendly and gave us tips about attending the graduation. The front desk staff were super friendly as well. The deli is open 24/7, and has fresh foods, beverages, beer and wine, and personal items.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK (nothing more, nothing less)”
Reviews.Author: ikelmay
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay an extra night after problems with our flights, and ended up reserving this hotel simply for convenience. The staff are very pleasant, the included continental breakfast adequate, but nothing much stands out beyond that. The hotel is badly in need of a sprucing up - it is looking shabby with an awful lot of duct-taped repairs and patchups. Our room was OK, again somewhat dated and ancient, with a noisy heating system and bathroom vent that could wake the dead as well as half the neighborhood. We were very fortunate to have a room that didn't back on to the I-5 as noise would have been an issue I suspect. The 'deli' is a very good facility for snacks and booze. Despite the advice given to us that Old Town is only a 15 minute walk away (and we are very fit and active) I suspect that would only apply if you were an Olympic athlete in training. Sorry guys, despite the perceived value for money, the hotel wasn't up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sacrebleu62
Reviews.Content: Everyone here was very pleasant, from the (free) shuttle driver to the various front desk staff. Nice room with microwave and largish fridge, good cable TV and strong wifi signal. The deli is a real plus - we got a bottle of wine to drink with out Las Brasas takeout. Very large breakfast with eggs and real waffles that you make yourself with a waffle iron. Excellent experience on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Most accommodating Hotel I've stayed in years!”
Reviews.Author: MSKBZW
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of any hotel but after staying here for our son's Marine graduation, I had to write this review. We were treated with such courtesy and kindness by everyone there, it was amazing. They accommodated our every need. We used the free shuttle on a daily basis with no problems. They arrived at the airport to pick us up within 5 minutes after our arrival. The drivers were all informative and happy. They never made you feel like you had imposed on their time. They were always happy to give you great tips about restaurants and sightseeing. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to the shops and restaurants in Old Towne. If you are looking for a hotel to stay in for your son's Marine graduation, this is it. They will get you on base in a quick and efficient manner. They even started running the shuttles early to make sure everyone got on base in plenty of time to see our loved ones. The rooms are clean though not fancy. We had five in our room with 2 queen beds and one roll away with plenty of room. They have a great little convenience store in the lobby for all those little things you might have forgot or those late night snacks. The morning breakfast was a great deal as well. We had waffles, bagels, cereal, fresh fruit, boiled eggs and pastries. Overall, I could not ask for any more from a hotel - friendly, clean and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not close to any fast food restaurants”
Reviews.Author: singlemomtraveller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from visiting San Deigo for the Chargers game. Unfortunately the charger lost but we had a very comfortable stay. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I had some issues with my in-room safe and they had someone come immediately and check it out. Unfortunately, they couldn't get it to work but offered me the ability to use their safe. They also offer free shuttle to San Diego Zoo and the airport - very friendly drivers. About a mile from the local trolley system that will take you directly to the Qualcomm stadium. It was wonderful! The Trolley station is where the train station is so very close! The old town atmosphere is nice but not really for teenagers. We chose this place due to the closeness to the trolley system to the football stadium and the fact it had a free shuttle to the zoo and the airport. The only thing I was not happy with is that there is no fast food restaurants around. We did order in Pizza so my teenagers were happy about that ... but we really would have preferred to walk to a fast food restaurant. The other issue I had is that there were these little beetles in the room ... that disgusted me! They were NOT bedbugs .. the beds and bathroom was very clean ...

Reviews.Title: “Great value and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Mo3ok
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for decent, no-nonsense accomodations in San Diego, this is your place. I was attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center and all the closer hotels were booked so I had to pick this hotel. Not to worry! The Comfort Inn shuttle bus took me to the Convention Center and brought me back. The shuttle typically leaves on the hour and it is best to sign up for it one day in advance. The shuttle is also free to and from the airport. The rooms are spacious and clean. The complimentary continental breakfast is fine. Wireless internet is free. I should emphasize that all the staff, from the shuttle drivers to the desk employees were very courteous and accomodating. The hotel is perched on a street overlooking the San Diego Freeway and is a 5 min shuttle ride from the airport. The first night I had a room on the highway side. There was some traffic hum but it did not bother me. Nonetheless, I requested a room facing the city street and the staff was happy to accomodate my request when such a room became available. The hotel is on the southern edge of Old Town, which means it is a 10 min walk from the center of Old Town. For an inexpensive Mexican meal, try Dos Brasas on the corner from the hotel. It does not look like much but the food is great. There are plenty of restaurants in the center of Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: Techboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located in Old Town but a 10-15 minute walk away. Free shuttle from the airport and to the zoo and Seaworld. The room was very spacious. The hotel has free breakfast which was ok with your typical selection of items and can get crowded. There is also a in room safe which is handy. Microwave and mini fridge also but both were old, they did work so not a big deal. If you want to eat somewhere close by I would recommend you avoid Old Town and instead walk over to Washington St. There is a variety of restaurants there and that seems to be where locals actually eat. There is a on site deli/convience store which is nice however I don't appreciate having different expiry date stickers being put on the sandwiches. The staff was helpful but not friendly, especially the Asian girl. It seemed like you were bothering her if you asked a question. Also one of the maids threw out my mouthwash for some reason. On the day I went to Sea World the hotel forgot to come back for me. Had to take taxi as my cellphone had died so I couldn't call the hotel. The hotel actually has free shuttle to the Amtrak station also but when I tried to use it they said that my request for 10AM was in conflict with them taking people to the zoo which is at 9:30AM?!?!? Even with the problems I dealt with I would probably stay there again but barely.

Reviews.Title: “The bad outweighed the good...”
Reviews.Author: kmokerr
Reviews.Content: While this was not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, it certainly was not the best. The hotel does have some good things going: -Free parking! -Free wi-fi -Free continental breakfast -Pool and hot tub -Location is decent - close to highway and within walking distance to Old Town -Nice TVs with cable However, I did find some things to be lacking: -We checked into the hotel around noon (they let us check in early, which was nice) and went out to do some sightseeing. Upon returning to our room, I noticed that our desk was covered with ants. I thought perhaps something was spilled, but when I went over to our nightstand, that too was crawling with ants. We called the front desk immediately and they did tell us to pack our things and come right down to the front desk. However, they put us in a room right next door to where we had been (where we actually found 3 more ants) and weren't exactly apologetic about the situation. The gentleman at the front desk only apologized after we actually showed him pictures we took. We felt that could have been handled a bit better. -Both the first room and our new room smelled old and musty. We tried to open our windows and turn on the air conditioning, but every time we returned to our room it still smelled pretty gross. -The shower heads were extremely low making for an uncomfortable shower. I am 5'7 and the shower head hit me at mid-forehead. I did not have it as bad as my 6'3 husband however! -I tried out the fitness center one day, hoping to run a bit on the treadmill. However, there was a big dip right in the middle of the running belt, which not only made it impossible to run, but also quite dangerous for anyone who tried. -We did have the continental breakfast every morning. Two complaints about this: 1. The toaster was extremely SLOW and didn't function very well. It literally took 8 minutes to toast a piece of toast. 2. To add to this, one morning a woman in a Comfort Inn uniform was using the toaster to make her own breakfast, so all of the guests had to wait until she was done to use it. I think it's just common sense that your guests should be first priority. Despite some of the good things about this hotel, I really wouldn't recommend it to my family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for decent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie2579
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days in April. We were on a strict budget, but didn't want to sacrifice safety or location. This hotel is a great compromise for those who want a lower priced room and a decent location. It's not in the heart of the city, but pretty darn close and a great price. At first glance we were a little hesitant about the hotel. It is in an old neighborhood, there was a good amount of construction, and it's literally right next to the freeway. However, even when walking many blocks to Old Town at night, we felt safe. The underground parking was secure and FREE which is a plus in San Diego. Also, the elevator and all hotel entrances required a room key to access which made us feel secure.The windows overlooking the freeway were thick and there was little noise. I can't say much for the view, but we didn't come to San Diego to look out of our hotel window, so we didn't care. The fridge and microwave were great since we brought snacks and were able to store leftovers. The hot tub was wonderful and deserted (at least when we were there). The room and premises were very clean and the breakfast was adequate but nothing special. The 24-hr "store" was a great help when my husband got sick in the middle of the night, though the prices are about as high as any convenience store. The staff was very friendly, and the business center, although small, came in handy when we wanted to research local activities. The walk to Old Town may be daunting for some (about 15-20 min) but was ok for us since we're pretty active people. The drive to downtown and the oceanfront was VERY quick and easy. Balboa park was also only a 10min drive. We had a corner room and so the noise level in the hotel did not bother us. All in all it was a great stay and we will definitely come back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hap64
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel. Everything was clean and well taken care of. Breakast was plentiful. No probs with noise or parking and was in an excellent location to head on down to Old Town, which was awesome, as well. My single complaint was that the shower heads weren't high enough on the walls. They were fine for me, but my 6 ft boyfriend had a hard time ducking under them to get wet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Hotel Old Town,San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sunnyville_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was great & friendly,free breakfast,pool,& the hotel shuttle took us everywhere we wanted to go for free,more than a radius of three miles.Hotel also picks you up at the airport & takes you back for your flight,no charge..most hotels don't do this.I will stay here again.The price was $79.00 per nite.

Reviews.Title: “Most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mills50
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful and the rates were very reasonable. Our room was located next to the pool with a patio area just outside our door. It was nice not to be confined to an inside corridor. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Cousinkk
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - close to Old Town (about 6 blocks) and a 10 minute walk to the Washington St. Trolley station, which gives you access to downtown. The trolley actually goes all the way to the Mexican border. It also has a free shuttle to the airport, sea world and the San Diego Zoo. (scheduled times) I enjoyed my stay and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ....perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MJWSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: We had an extra day in San Diego before flying home and wanted to see Old Town plus spend a few hours on the beach. Front desk help was great and the continental breakfast was perfect. For an extra fee, we were allowed to stay in our room until 4 pm, which was most welcome. Haven't seen that offered anywhere before, but it was low season. Not sure why people complain of highway noise......the two layer window kept the freeway noise to a pleasant hum, which helps me sleep better. We had stayed at a Courtyard by Marriott the previous year in San Diego, and this place beat it hands down for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: BonnieN3
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, rooms clean, close to old town (walking distance), and service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL WITH GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: mungi
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, good breakfast, attractive pool and courtyard area, but noisy as it is right next to the highway and very close to the airport. We were lucky to have a room on the "pool" side of the building, but another couple we met had a room on the other side of the hall and didn't get a wink of sleep because of the traffic noise. Friendly staff and good breakfast included. Great for stopover before a cruise but be sure to book your shuttle time early enough as shuttles are very busy and sometimes run late.

Reviews.Title: “I agree...nice, clean, friendly..great for families and business travelers”
Reviews.Author: lalagirl22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Comfort Inn twice in the last month since I teach at Thomas Jefferson down the street but commute for LA. Both times, the rooms have been clean, the staff has been friendly and helpful, and my stay has been nice. Things I liked about it: -free underground parking with direct access to room via garage -convenience market off lobby for snacks, drinks, microwave meals, toiletries, etc. -nice complimentary breakfast with hard boiled eggs, bagels, juice, make-your-own waffle, cereal, fruit and coffee -complimentary coffee throughout the day -quiet, even though across from airport (I never noticed any noise) -free wireless internet -ability to extend you checkout until 4pm for a fee -airport shuttle -fridge and microwave in the room Things I would like improved: -the bathrooms are just okay and the shower does not have much pressure - a disappointment after a long day of business travel -the heat/AC unit in the room worked well but I had trouble getting comfortable - a little hot or cold -the wireless internet signal was week All, in all, this is my go-to place when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Lomunchi
Reviews.Content: Not the fanciest place you'll ever visit but they were extremely accommodating and the people did everything they could to help us out. Their airport and Marine training ground shuttles were timely and willing to flex with us. Nothing really special about the place but the staff was great. (nice short walk to the Old Town also)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a family of five, convenient, great ammenities”
Reviews.Author: ld_swann
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for a family of five! We stayed at the Comfort Inn Old Town in a two room suite (# 324) with 2 queen beds, a sofa bed, a whirlpool tub, and 2 TVs. The suite was huge, the bathroom was huge, and the balcony was huge! The two walk in closets came in handy too as did the abundance of space; we never felt crowded. Yes, the hotel does overlook the freeway, but unless you are a very light sleep, it was just white noise. The view of the harbour from the balcony was very nice especially while have breakfast at the patio table provided. For those cruising as we were, you could see the cruise ships in port. The hotel was very clean, and well maintained. The amenities were exactly as advertised and everything (except the in-room safe) worked as it should. We enjoyed the continental breakfast which the staff always kept replenished, the business centre (2 computers to keep in touch with home or make travel arrangements), the hot tub, and the shuttle. The hotel staff were excellent; friendly and helpful whether arranging transportation via the hotel shuttle, local trolley or providing recommendations on where to eat. The shuttle was very convenient to use and included trips to Sea World. Other destinations could also be arranged within a 10 mile radius for a $25.00 fee; very convenient! The hotel is located just a short walk from historic old town San Diego, a state park that preserves the area’s history, and many restaurants and shops (open into the evening too!) Do plan to spend a little time exploring the culture and heritage, you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Clean”
Reviews.Author: supra14
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Xmas week. Everyone was friendly and helpful-real teamwork. The breakfast was great and the place was clean. They were very accommodating and I would recommend staying there to anyone of any age. Walking distance to Old Towne and all the fun there. I hope they keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NorthLincsChikky
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of getting standed in San Diego - don't ask. We found this Comfort Inn for 2 nights. Very impressed with the staff who couldnt do enough for us. Room clean and tidy and although next to the freeway the noise was minimal. Very impressed and would recommend most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - long wait for shuttles”
Reviews.Author: MN_TRAVELER86
Reviews.Content: GREAT employees - very friendly, but hotel does not provide ample staff to support the needs of hotel guests. It was obvious that staff were over worked, but handled situations to the best of their ability. Average stay, nothing special, but definitely not a bad place to be at. YES, it is near the highway, but what isn't in San Diego? Although traffic was close, could not hear noise when in the rooms. Don't rely on shuttles to get you anywhere "on time," if timeliness is a necessity, rent a car - especially when cruise ships are at port. Close to Old Town, lots of Mexican restaurants and shops to peruse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable room, in a great location when going to MCRD”
Reviews.Author: tcashae
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights but service was excellent. They got us in early. No problem with the road noise, really couldn't hear it. Only problem we encountered was a ice machine that wasn't working. Breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: redanteater
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to San Diego on business, but took the familiy along. This Comfort Inn is pretty nice; generally what one would expect in a Comfort Inn. The room was clean, new furnishings, bathroom, comfortable beds, nice Continental breakfast. In general, a pretty nice place, for a good price. Now the negatives: The room was a bit small, however. The hotel overlooks a freeway, and 60 percent of the rooms face the freeway, so there is a bit of noise throughout the night, and the walls were a bit thin so we could hear our neighbors (especially footsteps from above). Location is not in the immediate adjacency of anything, but within a 10 minute drive, there is the airport, Old Town, Downtown, Balboa Park, and Sea World. There's a bunch of local restaurants just down the street...which is nice, especially because these are all local run places, and not the big chains. I did walk to the Trolley, which made it convenient.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises.”
Reviews.Author: childrensauthor
Reviews.Content: Going in I knew the location was near the highway. Yes, you hear the muffled noise from the cars going pass your window. It did not bother me at all. The loud air conditioner is more of a distraction. Overall the stay was a great deal. Very close to Old town, which I wanted. Yummy, filling breakfast to start our day off for exploring. Comfortable beds, nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kennethpuyallup
Reviews.Content: nobody told us that the two bed rooms faced the freeway, actully just feet away ! I couldn't sleep at all. our air conditioner quit one night, but was repaired the next day. Our toilet Broke one day,but was repaired later that day. On 5/30 the fire alarms went off and water was pouring out of one of the rooms and up the hallway, the fire dept. came but no one from the hotel was around to give instructions, we got a discount , whoopie, 50% for that day. The front desk staff seemed like they didn't care much. The shuttle drivers were pretty cool. and housekeeping did a good job. BUT I WILL NOT STAY HERE AGAIN , I WOULD RATHER SLEEP IN MY CAR!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The ceiling leaked on us!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taime27
Reviews.Content: My now fiancé and I went to San Diego for a day at Sea World and what ended up being our engagement night. The room was really nice, I must say, and I was impressed (at first). The room we had was spacious with a king sized bed and beautiful bathroom. We went to Sea World, stopped for dinner and went back to the hotel. We ran a beautiful bath and it was perfect- until he started proposing. The ceiling began to leak on us!!! We tried to ignore it, but it soon began to be like rainfall over the jacuzzi tub and in the door way of the bathroom! We contacted the front desk who told us they had another room for us in the other building, so in the middle of the night, we had to pack up our things while being rained on and move. The front desk person was not very nice about it either. It was a mess. I was crying the whole night and the next day. The suite they moved us to had a balcony which had spider webs (I HATE SPIDERS!!!) and sunflower seed shells all over it. It was disgusting but the story made for a memorable engagement (not in a good way). I would definitely NOT stay here again. The room was nice but the area isn't. I would rather pay more money and stay in a nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Posies
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the freeway, but the noise isn't really a problem. From our window we could see planes taking off from the San Diego Airport, ships coming into port in the distance, and of course cars on the freeway. It's right down the road from Old Town San Diego, which has quaint little shops and a nice evening atmosphere. The breakfast is really good with many choices. The staff are really helpful and friendly. It also had free wireless internet in the room. Parking is free and underground (safe), and a lot of other hotels have parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the basics.”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights, choosing it primarily because of the location - very close to the house of friends I wanted to see. It is well maintained with a good staff, attractive plantings outside, and a well stocked deli/convenience store on site. The free breakfast is ample. I asked for a quiet room and was very glad that I did. On one side of the hotel, the rooms are literally a few yards away from the freeway and the traffic roaring by. My room was fine, but there are still soundproofing issues - I could hear the people in the room above walking around. I would stay here again - it is a great value for the price, centrally located in San Diego, and close to Old Town and the airport. Nothing fancy, but nothing bad, either.

Reviews.Title: “All the Best”
Reviews.Author: MommaJage
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and highly recommend the hotel!! -- Excellent location; residential area, close to airport, Old Town, and the highways. -- Very friendly staff. -- Breakfast was excellent with many choices including waffles, boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread, bagels, muffins, and danish; all refilled and fresh. Not enough seating during peak times. -- Room needed more storage space and we could hear the traffic noise a little.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZHeat200
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Feb 2009 and would stay there again. Good, clean hotel. Yes, it is right off the freeway but the noise didn't bother us. The windows are doubled so this blocks alot of the noise on the freeway side of the hotel, which is where our room was. The complimentary airport shuttle was great! The location of the hotel is a bit tricky. The parking is very tight, but most hotels are in San Diego. Atleast it was free. The breakfast was good. Offered breads, cereal, fruit, hard boiled egg, make your own waffle, juice, coffee. They have a convenience store in the lobby. A very nice patio to watch the airplanes come and go at the airport. Highly recommend staying at this Comfort Inn

Reviews.Title: “Freeway noise was bad...$100 hotel in a $25 location.”
Reviews.Author: Treysfar
Reviews.Content: The noise from the I-5 freeway was bad enough that my 6 year old daughter (who often falls asleep with noise around her) complained about it. The noise was distracting while playing games in the room and even watching the Chargers-Broncos game. It didn't bother me or my 8 year old son as much, but it was pretty bad for my wife and daughter. The other disappointment was that even though the place was recently refurbished, several things didn't work like they're new, or perhaps they're cheap and just-for-show. I fixed the toilet's lift chain because it was set too short so it constantly flushed; the diverter valve (the knob that switches the tub from shower to faucet) was very hard to move; I fixed the closet door because it was off its slider and wouldn't open; the light between the beds was broken (the fixture was loose and jiggled, and one side worked intermittently); and the drapes didn't close completely so the room was never totally dark. Also, it seems odd that the only rooms at the hotel with two beds are on the freeway side. The rooms on the other side have only one bed, so we couldn't be moved unless we paid $10 per night per extra rollaway bed...and crammed two of them into the smallish rooms. The amenities are nice with a good breakfast selection: hard boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, bagels, toast, drinks, etc. There's a pool, underground parking, and the staff was very friendly as long as you didn't bring problems to their attention. When I did, their response was average, but a little defensive. The rooms are clean and everything inside is new and nice enough. And having free Wi-Fi, and LOTS of HD channels was GREAT. We even got the HD version of the NHL channel!! If freeway noise doesn't bother you, or you plan on using the room solely as a bed to sleep in (and you have earplugs), this is a good deal and a great place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mg_in_kc
Reviews.Content: My family was in SD for our son's graduation from MCRD. Comfort Inn Old Town was close to the base, the airport, restaurants, the rental car drop off (Enterprise) and the beaches. Staff at the front desk were professional and ready to assist with directions, change, etc. The rooms were clean and accommodating, with small fridges. The breakfast bar was well-maintained. The patio area outside the entrance overlooked Pacific Highway, which was a bit noisy, but there was a great view of the airport and the downtown area. The rooms on the freeway side of the building were relatively quiet. I only heard the train whistles from time to time during the night. Parking was enclosed and free. The price was right. Overall, it was a nice, well-maintained place in a convenient location with helpful people, a nice view, and free parking. What more could you ask for? mg in kc

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel. The staff was pleasant. The location was awesome. Within walking distance of Old Town and a super short drive to downtown, the convention center, the beach and Mission Valley. They had a shuttle which we didnt use, but did notice they ask for 3 hours advance notice for use of the shuttle. They had breakfast in the morning- yogurt, cereal, bagels, pastries, etc. One of the best things is that they have a convenience store in the lobby, and the prices are surprisingly reasonable. The store even had beer! They also allow people to use the jacuzzi 24 hours. I was somewhat concerned that the hotel was going to be noisy, as the hotel overlooks I-5. Also, Our room was right next to the ice machine and laundry room, and had no problems whatsoever. The guests were respectful, and quiet. One minor glitch, our tv cable box quit working and they sent a handyman to swap it out. It was fixed within 30 minutes. Incidentally, the tv had hundreds of channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: derby222
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance to Old Town. Only minutes away from Airport and Cruise port. Also only a few miles to San Diego Zoo. People who worked there were very nice and helpful. Continental Breakfast was great - you can make your own waffles. One and only complaint was that the room we were in had a slight urine odor to it, but we moved to a different room and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sodajackson
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient with airport shuttle. The service was great and they were always willing to help. The breakfast was pretty good. The fitness room wasn't huge but it worked and had treadmill, eliptical, bike, weights. Didn't use the pool or jacuzzi. Overall my husband and I really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: buz513
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 5 nights in September 2008, being the last 6 days of a 2 month trip around the USA. We found that it was a brilliant place to stay. As our trip was based around staying at budget accomadation where possible(hostels, campgrounds) we found that the extra we paid to stay here was well worth it. First of all a great plus for us was the fact tht they had free internet on 2 computers in the lobby. Though there were only 2 computers but i found they were barely ever occupied and could get on it when ever i wanted. Second was free continental breakfast with wafles if you could be bothered making them in the wafle machines(i dont fancy them so i stuck to cereal, toast and bagels). Coupled to this was the fact there was a little general food and amenities store in the lobby that had everything from beer, sandwiches, soap, crisps, etc. It was open at all hours as you took the items and paid for them at the front desk of the hotel. There is also a laundry and clothes dryers that you can use for a few quarters. The location was definitly the best thing about the place. Oldtown was only about an 800m walk to the west, were there was an assortment of bars/restaurants(mainly mexican) and shops. By far we found the Coyote Cafe our favourite and went there 3 nights for Tea.
