Also in Oldtown was the bus terminal where we could get on a bus and go to Seaworld, Ocean Beach, Mission and Pacific Beach, or jump on the trolley(train) to get into downtown Sandiego. From downtown San Diego it was then just a bus trip to the San Diego Zoo or a walk down to the foreshore area where all the ship museams and the USS Midway is. If you didnt want to walk into Oldtown to get the trolly into downtown S.D, there is a closer station to the Comfort Inn called Washington. The people at the front desk can provide you with a print out on directions to get to pretty much all the touristy places and public transport routes. As for the room we found them to be great. Had a fridge, a/c, microwave, cable t.v and really comfotable bed. There was also a pool and a spa/jaccuzi if you feel like having a swim. Overall I would highly recommend this place to stay for anyone who is looking for cheaper hotel accomadation with easy access to everywhere in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, remote location”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan30
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here pre-cruise. Hotel shuttle driver was wonderful, friendly and helpful. The lobby and public areas of this hotel are lovely- marbel and lush plants. It is very clean. I saw employees cleaning from sun up to sun down. There is a small store with sandwiches and cold drinks and sundries in the lobby. There really are no resteraunts or stores within walking distance. I think we ended up having to order a pizza for dinner. Most attractions are a 20 min. cab ride away. This hotel is located in a residential neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRoisin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable with basic decor and have all convenient appliances . The hotel staff were all really friendly and helpful and seemed to genuinely enjoy their jobs. The hotel was definitely worth the money and didn't leave the impression that they were trying to suck out every extra penny, they even offer to supply any toiletries that you have forgotten at no extra charge. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Once Window was Fixed”
Reviews.Author: Salthawk
Reviews.Content: When we entered our room, we had to reattach the window curtain on one side and reattach the double-pane window in order to decrease the traffic noise from I-5. Our room, as well as all rooms with two queen beds are facing I-5. However, once we closed the double pane window, the traffic noise did not keep us from sleeping at night. Beds were comfortable and the management keeps rooms and hallways clean. Free underground parking off the street is a big plus. We walked to the Blue Line Trolley one day and rode this downtown; however, I would not feel safe walking through the neighborhood near Washington Street Trolley stop at night. The walk from Comfort Inn to Old Town restaurants is farther than we would have preferred. Would be better to drive. Easy driving distance to Mission Hills, Balboa Park, and the Hillcrest areas.

Reviews.Title: “Add me to the list”
Reviews.Author: rnbnut
Reviews.Content: Add my name to the list of satisfied guests at the Comfort Inn. We were very impressed all around. We don't like to lug around our laptops, so are dependent on hotel access. Couldn't be any better than here. Free, in room or in the lobby (seperate room with 2 terminals), wireless if you bring your own, everything. Nice room with plasma TV, smoking rooms available, excellent free breakfast, pool, hot tub, good location, great rates, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: summers333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Airport at Old Town for two nights while attending the Marine Graduation. We had a great stay that started when we called for the free shuttle to pickup us up from the airport until the same driver dropped us off two days later. The staff is WONDERFUL, FRIENDLY and VERY HELPFUL. We paid a few extra dollars a night for a King-sized bed but it was well worth it for the bigger. It was big enough to have a couch. Which was nice since everyone gathered in our room after the graduation but before the family flew home with their new Marine. We were shocked upon first walking into the room to see an LCD TV (HDTV) hanging from the wall. The room was clean and recently renovated. The window wouldn't open but that was okay because our room faced the freeway and the airport, neither of which we could hear. The room was also quite from the surrounding rooms. The hotel is located walking distance from Old Town and only a few miles from Sea World and Downtown. I would recommend it to others, especially those that don't want to spend a lot of money and/or you haven't rented a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great--especially for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitre10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this property while on vacation/ checking out the area for relocation. I usually like comfort inns as a standard, comfortable hotel and I was not disappointed at all. Even though this is called an airport hotel, you're not staying among warehouses with planes zooming overhead....you're in a neighborhood out of the flight pattern. Breakfast was very good (though I had to ask several times for various things to be refilled), the rooms were clean and nicely appointed, and the room was quiet. We did ask for a room not facing Hwy 5 and the person at the front desk obliged. The best part of this hotel, though, is its proxmity to Old Town. We thought that we were simply staying at an off-highway hotel but a very quick drive (or 10 minute walk) gets you to Old Town, a touristy but charming and fun neighborhood. We liked ffinding places for dinner there and then strolling around the state historical park after eating. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: chessie656
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Old Town for a week and found this hotel met all our needs above and beyond. The room was clean, all of the bathroom facilities worked well, and they gave us plenty of towels and soaps/shampoo. Our room faced the freeway and we weren't bothered at all by the slight noise that came in - the hotel has renovated the windows with extra inserts to shield the noise, and we both had no trouble at all sleeping. The free wireless internet in the room was great, as was the plasma screen tv on the wall with a large selection of channels plus HBO. The king size bed was more comfortable than our own bed at home! I've never been able to say that about a hotel bed, but this one was springy and had a plush top - very nice. Our room had an in-room safe that was shoulder level - all other places put them on the floor so you have to bend way down to get at them, or don't have them at all in the rooms. The refrigerator allowed me to keep my special milk cold so that I could bring it down to have at breakfast each day. We used the microwave to heat some leftovers when we got hungry one night. While we were there, we could see maintenance people working on some rooms doing some minor repair/improvements during the day, so there is ongoing care given to maintaining this hotel. There's a 24 hour store in the lobby that has just about anything you could want in a pinch. The breakfast was great and had a large variety of food available which was kept well stocked. We were able to get a table every morning, but at crowded times you may have to bring up your food to your room on a tray. The hot tub was clean and nice and hot - and open 24 hours. The pool was heated so well that we were able to swim comfortably even though the outside temps were in the 50's, and it was open until 10 pm which allowed us to sightsee all day and then finish the day with a relaxing swim. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, including the drivers we had (Alex and Rocky) for the van that shuttled us to and from the airport. Some of the staff would converse a little more with us than others, but they were still all helpful. We didn't rent a car; we took advantage of the public transportation system and found it worked very, very well. It was a 7 minute walk to a trolley stop and a 15 minute walk to the Transit Center in Old Town from the hotel. Just a note that the walk from the trolley stop back to the hotel at night was kind of creepy, as one of the roads wasn't well lit, so we avoided that area at night. Between the trolley and the buses, we were able to go to every destination we needed, and the drivers were pleasant and willing to answer any questions we had. We would definitely stay here again next time we come back to San Diego, and feel it was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: tonicalese
Reviews.Content: this is an A+ Hotel clean wherever you look.LCD Tv free internet superb breakfeast.Friendly motivated team. We travel a lot but this was a surprise stay we wish we had more often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place – Must Stay for Marine Recruit Families”
Reviews.Author: CorysFamily
Reviews.Content: This is a clean Hotel with updated furniture in the rooms. It’s near (not in) old town. They offer a shuttle to the airport and to the Marine base for Recruit Graduation. The rooms are a little small, but big enough and clean (not easy to find in San Diego if you want to stay under $150 per night). The continental breakfast is well above average with fresh fruit. The Hotel is right next to the freeway (on a hill – so seriously, RIGHT next to the freeway). However, we asked for and received a room away from the freeway and we couldn’t hear it all. If the price is right, we’ll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenties and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Love_2_Travel_djkljd
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San Diego from a cruise and just needed a place to stay for 1 night until my flight the next day. I chose the Comfort Inn for its price, location, amenities, and free airport shuttle. Some of the great things about this hotel: 32" plasma TV in every room. With a push of a button on the remote it becomes a 32" plasma computer monitor. There is free wireless & wired high speed internet access, a 24 hour deli/shop in the hotel, a free all you can eat breakfast buffet and a trolley stop just a few blocks away. And this free breakfast isn’t just a muffin and warm orange juice like other places. They had everything you could want. They even had a waffle maker set up so you could make your own fresh waffles. The room and bathroom looked recently remodeled. They both were very modern, nice, and big. The staff were all very friendly. When I asked how to get to the trolley stop they pulled a big color map out and gave it to me. It showed all the tourist spots and they even drew a path on it to show me how to get from the hotel to the trolley station. Above and beyond what most hotels would do. Most would just point and say "Go down that way and turn right". For complaints mentioned in other reviews about the noise: my window was so close to I-5 I could almost touch the cars, and I had no noise issues. The windows must be soundproof. I also had the A/C on all the time. If you have it on, even just on the low or the fan setting, you should not have any problems either. The hotel isn't in the best neighborhood in San Diego, but I never felt unsafe walking around. I had a great view of the San Diego skyline from my window and of the airport right across I-5. You are just 1 trolley stop away from the very nice Old Town area done up to look like the old west, and just a few trolley stops away from the San Diego waterfront with all the historic ships to visit and shopping at Seaport Village. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for an inexpensive, clean place to stay which is close to a trolley stop. This provides you easy access to all the other places in San Diego you might want to visit. You can even get on the trolley and go all the way down to the US-Mexico border and walk into Tijuana. Also the free airport shuttle is great so you can save money on taxi fare. No complaints from me. Give the hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “There ARE real reasons to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: northerndynasty
Reviews.Content: You can't get any better a review than by hearing it from someone who is writting from the very room they are staying in! It's long, but you get a bunch of facts when you're new to this location and really want to know as much as you can! I'll try to keep this brief and at the same time, informative. We'd never stayed here before and basically chose this hotel because of price, location, and an average of the previous reviews. The biggest standout of those 3 is definitely the location. You'll find yourself very near everything that San Diego has to offer. However, in our opinion, not close enough that "walking" is always an option. Have car...will need it to travel. The area around the hotel as you arrive doesn't look great, but rebuilding is taking place. Enjoy "riding" the nearby steep roads as a thrill if you're not used to it. Some have criticized the parking...the re-marking of the main floor parking lot confuses the real spots. They're fine! Sheesh...don't be so fussy! And decent parking below with sufficient room for even this "larger than average" fella. The hotel looks fine, grounds are clean, building appears freshly painted and well maintained. Lobby is bright and welcoming. Dave at the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful switching us rooms. Problem with the first one? No...we just wanted to be closer to the central area of the hotel. Even provided an early morning "check-in" as we arrived during "check-out" time. They say the windows have been upgraded to deal with the highway noise issue. At first...the noise is noticeable. But pretend it doesn't really bother you, turn the a/c fan on, and it really isn't that awful. If you're a light sleeper or internally affected by highway noise, ask for a hill-side room or keep on truckin'. Breakfast was decent...fresh, varied items from breads, to pastries, to fruit, juices, milk, cereals, waffles and so on. The other guests generally seem pleasant. You'll find that in the cruisers that are staying a night pre-sail-off. Not enough tables in the breakfast area creates new friends and shared spaces. The rooms are decently sized for short stays, and functional. Some items like out-dated furniture or appointments, are starkly contrasted by the massive HDTV and computer system INCLUDED! Whoa! Wireless throughout the hotel and in the room is complimentary! And so what if the room isn't chi-chi. You're not on vacation to stay IN the room, are you?! Get over it...it's a Comfort Inn, you're not spending a whole lot of money, and you're probably not staying all that long. "Deli" is more like an emergency hunger saver, and there's definitely enough sundries and snacks in the lil store. Just expect to pay a slightly higher premium for that kind of convenience. The only real negative thing I have to say is...and this is even worse than the occasional spot of cracked grout or other-than-purely-white cocking in the bathroom...and that is...ants. Weird as weird...there seems to be a few more ants than I'm comfortable with. I'll mention something in the morning, but it's not the worst thing I've ever dealt with. So, overall, I'd give this short-stay-rest-your-weary-eyes place, a 3.5...strong 3.5. We'd definitely stay here again, so long as the price is right...and today, it was. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: silverswans
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to stay in Old Town and found the best price here. The prior reviews did scare me a little but I'm glad we stayed anyway. The rooms and public areas were clean and well maintained. The bathroom looked recently updated. We did not have much free time in San DIego, so we did not mind that it is a basic hotel. We got the dreaded freeway room but the noise was not an issue as we run the A/C all night. Its not a resort by any means, but the pool was adequate, there was some nice landscaping and parking was no problem. The staff varied, some friendly, some just neutral. Having the store in the lobby was incredibly handy for snacks and drinks which saved us money at the attractions we visited. The free breakfast had the usual muffins, bagels and pastires, plus whole and cut fruit but also make you own waffles. A big hit with the kids and a nice quick start to the day. Staff kept the area clean and stocked. We liked the location alot. Being on the freeway actually gives you easy access to everything and it is a very central location being under 5 mi from the beaches or the zoo, even Mexico is not far. We walked to the Trolley Tours and really enjoyed that. You can see many major sites at your own relaxed pace and learn from the narration. The shops and restaurants in Old Town made for a great time. Especially Cafe Coyote, watch them make the tortillas and enjoy the mariachis. On Saturday there are many street vendors offering great souveniers and gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Tereible Experience - Avoid This hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OscarSeattle
Reviews.Content: Breakfast and internet TV nice. Hotel room is small, noisy and overpriced. It is close to all activities, but do yourself a favor go elsewhere. Do not book a reservation here. After a prior stay I cancelled due to family illness and got a conformation number and staff name. They have charged our credit card since and after calls, visiting the front desk in person they told my husband it would be taken off our credit card. No such luck! They have ripped us off for $132.56. Trust me GO SOMEPLACE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bioteach_7
Reviews.Content: My room was in the main part of the hotel facing the highway. It was a pleasant stay. There were no children on that end and despite the traffic it was amazingly quiet. I spent several evenings in the hot tub which was great. I spent many more mornings eating breakfast out on the terrace. Have I stayed in better hotels - you bet. But for the money (I was at a conference at USD), it was a pleasant surprise. Oh, I was there for seven days. Might I add, contrary to other reviews, the staff was most pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandblanc
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel but very clean and the staff was very helpfull and friendly. They provide transportation to and from the airport and for the activities in the Recruit Depot in San Diego. They were very helpfull providing information regarding places of interest. It is at walking distance from restaurants and old town. Convenient small store for snaks and basic needs. The rooms were very clean and even is close to the highway there was not to much noise. We like it because the staff was very helpfull and friendly. They really care for the customers and make a great effort to make you feel welcome. The rate was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLB
Reviews.Content: Those who are attending a graduation for their Marine, don't stay here. Even though it is close to base and advertise close to all attractions, this is a dirty hotel. The staff was very rude. We had 10 rooms and only 2 were cleaned prior to 5:00 p.m. Our suite never did get cleaned. The major issue was the toliet that kept backing up. They left us a plunger to do it ourselves. The gentleman who came to our door said "it's not MY job". We spent 2 days taking care of it ourselves. We had other guests that had to change rooms 4 times in 2 days. I too read the reviews before going and thought I would give it a chance since the travel agent told me their employees stay there. Please, pay a little extra and enjoy beautiful San Diego without worring about your room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: leavnLA
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience of my life. My jewelry was stolen from my room, and a very rude manager, Yazmine, was completely unhelpful and dismissive to my requests for information on how to pursue my complaint. I will never stay at a Choice Hotel again, and do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy and Rude Staff -- Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked in around 4:00 p.m. with my elderly parents in tow. I basically had to unload all their luggage for the evening myself, although there were bell hops around. That was fine. However, after unloading all the luggage from the motorhome, which was around 6:00ish, I came back to the room to find a flood in the bathroom of our room downstairs. By this time, I had already plugged in all my electronic equipment, i.e. Blue Tooth earpiece, Treo 650, Sony camcorder, etc. These things were placed on the floor and wherever I can find an extra plug -- which was right outside the bathroom and in the bathroom. When I asked for help, all that I was told was that they were short-handed and we would have to wait for someone to come up and apply towels to dry up the spill. OH, BUT FIRST, not after I had to stand by to hear all the accusations -- "someone must have put too much paper down the toilet", "someone put something that didn't belong", "this happens to people in their own homes", "what do you want us to do about it?" and so on . . . After having to remind myself that I didn't need to explain or apologize for something we did not do (after careful investigation), I requested another room, which should have just been offered in the first place, without any accusations. The next morning I asked to speak with the Supervisor, which I did, and she also was very defensive and stated "We put you in another room! There is nothing else we can do." I reminded her that I had to request another room it was not offered, only after hearing all the accusations and how they didn't have time to help out. I don't know who sets the tone there at this location, but it was the worst experience I ever had at a Comfort Inn. I have traveled since I was 15 years old and I am 45 years old, I thought your staff was lazy and they sure have a chip on their shoulder. I was told afterwards, by the "Supervisor" that she would discount my room by 20%, which I haven't seen on my credit card as of yet. Not only am I posting this review on TripAdvisor, but I will also send out this negative information to all my 2,000 data-based clients. Truly a horrible experience. Sincerely, Cathy Bernal ---- ----

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but great”
Reviews.Author: nettermo
Reviews.Content: First the negative - as other reviewers have stated, it is located on (almost literally) I-5 and there is constant highway noise if you are on that side of the hotel, where we were. But the drapes dampened the noise quite a bit and having the air conditioner on high speed helped even more. It didn't disturb our sleep at all, and we're not heavy sleepers. Other than that, there was absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel, at least for our purposes. We weren't there to swim or spend time in the hotel, so we were there only in the evenings and to sleep. Room was very comfortable with both a small fridge and microwave. The "continental" breakfast was better than most other Comfort Inns we've stayed at. They had the standard waffle machines, but their large selection of pastries and fruits was wonderful. I thought maybe they had a special breakfast for Sundays (which was our first morning there), but it was just their standard fare. There was a slight glitch in the room charge at first, because I had received a different rate than what was showing up on their computer. But they called the home office, which verified my rate and it was cleared up quickly. The two gals on duty when we checked in were very friendly and helpful and joked around with us. Our room was ready when we arrived. By the way, the large bowl of apples that they always have at the front desk for their guests is a nice touch. They also have a well-stocked convenience store there in the lobby which is open 24 hours. Since there is no restaurant on the premises, it was nice to have when the munchies hit later in the evening. Guests charge "reasonably priced" purchases to their room. Since we always travel with a lap top, the free wi-fi in the room was appreciated. The hotel, although not in the upscale part of town, was conveniently located to most of the attractions. We had a rental car, so proximity to public transportation was not a factor for us. The parking garage was under the hotel, well lit and reasonably secure. Neither of us felt unsafe at any time. If you're looking for a posh hotel, go downtown to the Hyatt. But if you're looking for a comfortable, affordable hotel, I'd recommend this one. Just request a room on the opposite side of the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Warning from experienced traveler: 100% Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There should be NO "star" for this hotel. Stayed at this hotel, as many others have, as it was close to Marine graduation. Big deal. I would have rather traveled 50 miles that morning, than to have experienced this hotel. Number 1: We had to wait over an hour for our room to be ready, in spite of them having our reservation for weeks (in other words, they knew we were coming.) Then, we were informed very rudely that "well, you know these rooms take 2 hours to clean!!") They offered NO compensation whatsoever...no discount, no future stay at a Comfort Inn, no complimentary anything, not even an apology. 2. The clerks - every single one of them - had major attitudes. As if THEY were doing us a favor by "giving" us a room we had paid for!! The three girls that morning - very rude and not apologetic whatsoever for the fact that our room was not ready, and that we had to wait over an hour. My son arrived a little later, and was also treated rudely when he merely asked for a copy of his key to the room. The following morning when we checked out, more rudeness by the two front desk personnel. Obviously, NO customer service training whatsoever (Note: I worked for Hyatt Hotels for over 8 years, and have also been an avid traveler all my life, so this is not acceptable behavior from ANY hotel personnel, I am fully aware what customer service looks and feels like.) The sad thing is, my entire family - total of 6 rooms - were booked at this hotel, and not one of my 12 family members had a positive word to say about this hotel and its personnel and/or rooms. 3. The room was absolutely horrible. Cigarette butts visible on the ledges outside; cigarette burns in the carpet; Even the note pads were used and had water stains and were warped - such an easy thing to remedy. But the WORST thing was the EXTREME NOISE. Right on top of the very heavily traveled freeway, impossible to sleep, really impossible. So, unless you want to stay up and party all night and get no sleep at all, go ahead and book your room at this undesirable (understatement) establishment. In summary, there is nothing about this hotel that I would recommend. NOTHING.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location for basic accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on the way up to San Francisco, and it was a great find for the money. I've read some of the other reviews and I know it's been mentioned about the noise from the highway. That may be a negative to some (I don't know firsthand), but we were lucky enough to stay on the street side of the hotel so we didn't experience that. The fridge and microware were a plus, and we had all of the accommodations we needed. The free continental breakfast was good (yummy waffles!). I don't remember if anyone wrote any negative reviews about that, but how much can you expect when it's a free "continental" breakfast? I've been to places where they put out a coffee machine and some stale jelly doughnuts (who wants that for breakfast??). This hotel had a pretty nice selection - toast, waffles that you make yourself, fruit, juice, etc. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Regarding the user who claimed discrimiation of some sort, my boyfriend and I are an interracial couple and didn't see any evidence of discrimination at all. They did everything they could to accommodate any requests we had. I'd recommend staying here, but be sure to ask for a room not on the highway side if you think that's going to be a problem. If you're a heavy sleeper, then it won't matter. One other item to mention - we didn't get a chance to really experience Old Town except for going to dinner the night we arrived...what a cute little place! Lots of Mexican restaurants around with a very festive atmosphere (We went to the Coyote Cafe which had the best margarita chicken dish I've ever had). Not sure it's necessarily a "walk" to Old Town but definitely a short drive. If I come back to San D I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for MCRD Graduation!”
Reviews.Author: tripplans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Airport in April for my nephew's graduation from boot camp at MCRD. We were pleasantly surprised to find it so close to the MCRD gate we used for both Thursday and Friday. The location was a definite plus for our trip, since we wanted to be on the Marine depot by 6:30 am each morning! We found the rooms to be clean and everything in working order. People at the desk were friendly and efficient. The breakfast was great, lots of good choices and the fresh fruit was wonderful. The room prices were just right for this type of hotel. We had an AARP member with us and were able to receive a very good rate. We could even see MCRD from our room and from the courtyard outside, which was neat, especially since we had not seen our Marine for 3 long months and just looking at the depot from our hotel and knowing he was in there was emotional enough, let alone his actual graduation! Very pleased with this Comfort Inn and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A really awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the esplanade of a very nosy highway, and under the flight path of the airport. It is very noisy. The staff are rude to say the least. We asked Melissa for a receipt which she was unable to provide. She went on to tell us that most hotels do not provide them and she would know as she travels more than us. It would be funny but we were travelling on business and need the receipt for our expense forms. The hotel did provide an OK breakfast, and it is located close to old town, but these are not enough to redeem it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here with my 3 children (ages 6-10). The rooms are fine for the price. Ask for room on street side (to avoid highway noise!) The breakfast was great...cook-your-own waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries etc. (Note to hotel...need more tables in breakfast area.) Easy walk to Old-Town, but not much else. In general, decent hotel for budget-minded travelers. Small convenience store on premises is an added benefit.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with sound effects”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noise; lots of freeway noise. Rooms, OK. Pool: Motel 6 has a much better one. Jacuzzi: people from the apartment complex across the street come to use it; easy access for anyone off the street. TV: limited choices (no MTV, no Comedy Central, etc.) Three good things: near all major San Diego attractions; 2 computers with free Internet access; and, a good continental breakfast with make-your-own waffles. Staff: most slightly unfriendly - especially the night-time fat brunnette and the heavy-smoking older mustache guy. Parking: unguarded and easy target for thieves. This place is for you if you just want a place to shower (no bath tub plug) and sleep, and be on the go to your touristy locations. Peace out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked our room (for 2 adults, 1 child, 3 nights) through an online site. When we arrived at the hotel they had booked us for a single-bed room. The clerk did get us into a double, finally! We left the hotel (after first night) for a day of sightseeing and came back and couldn't get into room. Said it was mistake, that they had us down for one night. (yeah right after verifying everything on check in!) This occured again the next day!! We were there for graduation at MCRD (which we could see out our window!) on Friday and our new Marine had asked us if we could arrange for late check-out so he could change out of his uniform before travelling for 6 hours. We made arrangements on Thursday for late check out on Friday. We made sure again on Friday morning before leaving for graduation. But AGAIN we came back to the room, and we couldn't get in!! Another trip to the office to be able to get into our room. The breakfast was great, if you were there early enough. The room was clean! Would we stay there again??? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “good name comfort.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed in comfort inn airport oldtown july 2003 and had a lovely time. Bus stops outside the door but oldtown was in walking distance if you felt like it. Loved the lobby and the places outside to sit and eat breakfast which was very good.Would like to go back if the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But better Hotels in area for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not customer freindly because you need to walk outside to get to the lobby and other hotel areas. The overall apperance was average and the service was ok. Highway noise is somewhat of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Airport at Old Town is a great place to stay if you're looking for a laid back atmosphere, but want easy access to the city.But if you don't like to walk, don't stay here! The hotel is within walking distance (about a 15 min. stroll) to Old Town, which has the best Mexican food in the city and some good souvenir shops and unique boutiques! Plus, walk 5 min. in one direction and you're at the Washington Trolley Station or 20 min. the other way and you're at the Old Town Transit Center. If you're interested in taking a taxi (which you'll need to do if you don't have a car), don't go through the hotel - instead, stick with the Yellow Tax Cab of San Diego (they have the best rates and prompt pick-up).The staff is attentive and the entire hotel, including my room, was SO clean! Although my room overlooked the highway, I never really considered the sounds of traffic to be bothersome - just mere background noise, which I probably wouldn't have noticed if I hadn't read about it in the Sept. 10, 2003, review.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It has a perfect location, walking distance from old town and has 2 close trolley stops from where you can go virtually to any place in San Diego. The rooms are clean, friendly service in the front desk and nice breakfast. Also free internet in the lobby, I trully recomend this hotel! ;)

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express San Diego Airport - Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: 1955 San Diego Avenue, San Diego, CA 92110 (Formerly Comfort Inn Airport at Old Town)
